alert.note: Alert for Butler; Montgomery; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 05 at 3:18AM EDT until September 05 at 7:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Southwest Ohio and West Central Ohio, including the following counties, in Southwest Ohio, Butler and Warren. In West Central Ohio, Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 630 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 318 AM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Dayton, Kettering, Middletown, Miamisburg, Lebanon, Springboro, Monroe, Franklin, Bellbrook, Moraine, Carlisle, Oakwood, South Middletown, West Carrollton, Waynesville, Hunter, Germantown, Centerville, Five Points and Pekin.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
